intro: Mentha × rotundifolia var. cinereovirens, commonly known as gray-green mint, is a hybrid plant belonging to the mint family (Lamiaceae). It is characterized by its round, gray-green leaves that are slightly hairy, giving it a distinctive appearance. The plant produces small, pale blue or violet flowers that bloom in whorled clusters along the upper stems. It is often found in moist, shaded environments such as woodlands and stream banks. This variety is valued for its aromatic leaves and is sometimes used in herbal teas or as a decorative plant.
